conversations.content: How many national parks are there in Arizona?

Arizona is home to three national parks: Grand Canyon National Park, Petrified Forest National Park, and Saguaro National Park. [oai_citation_attribution:5‡Dirt In My Shoes](https://www.dirtinmyshoes.com/arizona-national-parks/?utm_source=chatgpt.com)
Can you list all the national monuments in Arizona?

Arizona has several national monuments, including: Canyon de Chelly, Casa Grande Ruins, Chiricahua, Montezuma Castle, Navajo, Organ Pipe Cactus, Pipe Spring, Sunset Crater Volcano, Tonto, Tuzigoot, Walnut Canyon, and Wupatki. [oai_citation_attribution:4‡American Southwest](https://www.americansouthwest.net/arizona/national-parks.html?utm_source=chatgpt.com)
What is unique about Saguaro National Park?

Saguaro National Park, located in Tucson, Arizona, is renowned for protecting the nation's largest cacti, the giant saguaro, which is a universal symbol of the American West. [oai_citation_attribution:3‡National Park Service](https://www.nps.gov/state/az/index.htm?utm_source=chatgpt.com)
Where is Petrified Forest National Park located?

Petrified Forest National Park is situated in northeastern Arizona, near the town of Holbrook. [oai_citation_attribution:2‡National Park Service](https://www.nps.gov/state/az/index.htm?utm_source=chatgpt.com)
What can visitors see at Walnut Canyon National Monument?

Visitors to Walnut Canyon National Monument can explore ancient cliff dwellings nestled within canyon walls, offering insights into the lives of the Sinagua people who inhabited the area over 700 years ago. [oai_citation_attribution:1‡American Southwest](https://www.americansouthwest.net/arizona/national-parks.html?utm_source=chatgpt.com)
